org.raistlic.common.permutation

Class Combination<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.raistlic.common.permutation.Combination<E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<java.util.List<E>>

    public class Combination<E>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<java.util.List<E>>
    Utility class for easy query of all possible combinations of "picking m elements from an n-size collection". It basically provides the functionalities of : 1 - enquiry the number of combination count of combination(m, n) 2 - given an ordinal number i, fetch the i-th combination sequence as a read-only list. 3 - convenient for-each iteration of all the combinations It is NOT thread safe. It re-uses one array to fetch the combination, so if the user want to keep the i-th combination result, make a copy.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Combination.Algorithm
      A callback interface that implements the combination algorithm.

    • Method Detail

      • of

        public static <E> Combination<E> of(java.util.Collection<E> elements,
                                    int numberToPick)
        Factory method that exports a combination instance with the specified elements collection and numberToPick , using the default algorithm implementation.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the element type.
        Parameters:
        elements - the elements collection to pick combination from, cannot be null.
        numberToPick - the number of elements to pick, must be no less than 0 and no more than elements size.
        Returns:
        the combination instance.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - when any of the parameters is invalid.

      • of

        public static <E> Combination<E> of(java.util.Collection<E> elements,
                                    int numberToPick,
                                    Combination.Algorithm algorithm)
        Factory method that exports a combination instance with the specified elements collection and numberToPick , using the algorithm callback provided, or the default algorithm if the algorithm parameter passed in is null.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the element type.
        Parameters:
        elements - the elements collection to pick combination from, cannot be null.
        numberToPick - the number of elements to pick, must be no less than 0 and no more than elements size.
        algorithm - the algorithm as a callback for picking combinations, or null if using the default algorithm.
        Returns:
        the combination instance.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - when any of the parameters is invalid.

      • getCombinationCount

        public java.math.BigInteger getCombinationCount()
        Returns the number of all possible combinations.
        Returns:
        the number of all possible combinations.

      • getCombination

        public java.util.List<E> getCombination(java.math.BigInteger ordinal)
        Returns the ordinal-th combination result, as a List .
        Parameters:
        ordinal - the index of the combination result to return, cannot be null and must be no less than 0 and must less than getCombinationCount().
        Returns:
        the ordinal-th combination result.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - when ordinal is null or out of the valid range.

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator<java.util.List<E>> iterator()

        The iterator returned here is a read-only iterator, and does not support Iterator.remove() operation, calling the method will cause an UnsupportedOperationException.

        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<java.util.List<E>>
